alert.note: Alert for Kimble; Mason; McCulloch; Menard (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Kimble, southwestern McCulloch, southern Menard and northwestern Mason Counties through 830 PM CDT... At 744 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Ranch Road 1773, or 9 miles southwest of Menard, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Menard, Long Mountain, Calf Creek, Saline, Streeter, Hext, The Intersection Of Highway 29 And Ranch Road 1222, The Intersection Of Us-83 And Ranch Road 1773, Erna, Us-83 Near The Kimble- Menard County Line, Us-377 Near The Kimble- Menard County Line and The Intersection Of Us-83 And Highway 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
